comment: Point system- 50 points for attendance 50 points for revel 400 points for 4 tests directly from revel readings

He's boring as all get-out but the assignments are easy and if you can go to class and stay awake, you'll get some good information from his lectures. His tests are literally pulled straight from the online textbook readings, which I would do because they also contribute towards your grade. Boring but a nice guy

As long as you watch your absences and keep up with revel you should do well. The test questions can be confusing so make sure you have the vocab memorized. If you don't then the wording will get you. If you want an easy A take his communications class. However, it is dreadfully boring and I got nothing from it. Filler class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures everyday, which can get tedious. He likes to tell jokes and personal stories which makes the lectures more enjoyable. If you read the book, you'll be fine for the tests. Lots of quizzes on Revel. Only  5 major homework assignments. 4 Tests total. No cumulative final. If you can, take this class.  It's not too much to handle.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There is a total of 4 tests, 5 HW assignments, and a lot of Revel work. He does NOT allow any sort of electronic device, -20pts off your final grade if you do. The dude lectures a lot, most of the information is useless and read off a power points. Tests are based off of vocab words, examples, and people's theories. Good luck!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. He is hilarious and very likable. He makes you do reading and quizzes online, called REVEL, and its easy. I'm a Communications major and I had trouble with his tests, only because I never knew what to study. There's a textbook, but I never found it useful, just the powerpoints.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: would never take Professor Mcdonald again. there's tons of reading and quizzes and he does nothing but read the book during his lectures. tests are confusing. he also cusses every other word, which gets annoying and unprofessional. he acts like he knows everything there is to know about everything, so I didn't care for his personality at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall the reading is really easy along with the actual course itself. The lectures can get a bit old after a while but even those can be entertaining at times. The tests however are were things go sideways; the questions can be worded so vaguely that even when you study it can be difficult. He's a good guy, funny stories, but annoying tests.

McDonald's is very entertaining and knowledgeable of the material he teaches. He relates everything back to real life, and has many funny and interesting stories to tell. He encourages in-class discussion. As long as you study for his tests and do the homework assignments, you'll do fine... Take him!

For a communication professor he lacks in communication skills. I think he lost his mind toward the end of the semester. Overall, its a communication class... its easy. The tests are mostly made up of vocab words from the chapter. DO NOT BUY THE ACCESS CODE (you don't need it)

Funny teacher, might cuss a bit, but us college students like that. Has a lot of life stories, bags on himself a lot but its funny. Don't play on your phone bc he will call u out. Listen to his lectures and mentally process it, don't waste your time on writing notes just look at the power points he posts. Test are kinda hard but u can do it.
Easy class, cool open minded guy. Just go over the PowerPoints before the test and your straight.

This professor is not terrible but I would not take him if I was you. He goes very fast through the lectures and the tests are very hard and do not reflect the notes in class. You do need the book cause there are assignments in there. Make sure you go to class cause he takes off points for every day you miss class. Just do not take him.

Jim is an interesting guy for sure. He has MANY stories to tell. There's regular homework, but it's stuff that literally takes 5 min to do. Tests are pretty specific, so know the vocab & study your lecture notes. Overall he's pretty cool, I'd take him again.

He's a great professor! There are 6 tests (some hard) and a lot of other work, but it's manageable. He places you in groups and you sit with that group the entire semester. There are group competitions, but they are extra credit. He is a tough grader when it comes to grammar, so proof read everything. I found him really funny. Take him!

I really enjoyed this class! He grades on a point based system so it is very important to show up to class and do all the assignments. He makes it clear what material will be on the tests and he puts the lecture slides on D2L.  The lectures are enjoyable and the makes the class interesting with group competitions. I would recommend his class.

Great professor and willing to make time to help students. Make sure your group is good and volunteer. Failed two tests, got a low A, high A, and solid B on the final and I ended with an 80 in the class. With bonus points, I got an 88. Definitely study, the two tests I failed  were the ones I was least prepared for. Exam is pretty much on quizlet.

Good class to take for an A. Powerpoints are all online, but he counts off your final grade for every missed class. Lectures are usually short and involve a group activity that is fun. Tests and final are very easy and come straight from the powerpoints.

I loved professor Mcdonald. He is funny and helps. Also, do not use your class. You dohave to review powerpoints and you will be okay. Make sure that what you study, you actually learn for the cummulative test. Dont miss class because it will help in the long run. Promise!! Take him. you wont regret it

Good teacher, it is a breeze until it comes to test. Test are HARD!! Not as easy A, mot an easy B, they are an easy C. You have to study for an A or B. All of the bonus points help your grade though. Take if you want to learn, but don't if you want an easy A.

Professor McDonald is great! Easy A, you will be put into a group in the beginning of the semester, you do EVERYTHING with your group (even sit with them during class.) If you know the vocab you will pass the tests. Fun class and instructor, don't be on your phone, pay attention and participate; you'll enjoy. Do the work and you'll get an A.

Professor McDonald is a great professor! He is so funny and keeps the class engaged. He gives a lot of group work and team challenges! The tests arent bad as long as you pay attention in class and use his vocab on D2L. Should be an easy A
Doesn't allow laptops for taking notes. Teaches like it's a high school class but at least it was easy.

You'll be in a random group for the entire semester, but all of the assignments are easy, so you'll be fine. There are so many opportunities for extra credit, you just have to show up (lose 2pts when absent). He's funny & very experienced in the ad biz. Strict on his no electronics policy. Just put it up. 4-5 test. Can fail a test & still pass prob

Jim Mcdonald is a funny guy and he's very blunt and honest. He's great at explaining things and uses repetition  in order to drill it into your brain. May or may not sling a few cuss words around. Take him for sure
He is very clear in what he expects from his students. Be prepared for a lot of group work.

Really good teacher. Lectures can be boring but he always cracks jokes to keep you awake and paying attention. Group work is easy and there is alot of extra credit. Come to class, if you miss you get a point taken off for every day missed out of 30 points. Did not need the book. Show up, take some notes, study his PPTs online. Tests are vocab based
Loved him! Great professor, super funny and posts his notes online. All his tests can be found quizlet. Super easy A as long as you go to class. Don't buy the textbook though bc you wont even open it

Professor McDonald is super funny! He makes the class very interesting and never boring. He helps you with your needs all the time. All of his tests are 50 questions and are mostly vocab based. As long as you study, I am sure you will fly by in his class. You are always having fun and he does a few extra credit group activities, which are fun!

McDonald is great! Hilarious! Some found class boring because of the lectures.. but his humor makes it so much better!! He puts you into groups for the semester and you do a lot of group work. It's fun though!! The tests are 50 questions.. not bad at all!! Just do what he says and you'll have an A. I definitely recommend his class

McDonald is a really funny guy. He explains communications well. We didn't move as quickly as he planned at the beginning of the semester, so he dropped things we couldn't get to instead of rushing it. Attendance is part of your grade. He hates technology in his class. His tests were long, but I didn't have to study much to get a B. Recommended.
Great professor. Easy A. Attendance is not recommended. Tests are extremely easy as long as you study the vocab he posts on D2L. Rarely used the book.

He is very boring!! The class I thought would be a easy A but it isnt't, maybe because I don't pay attention in class. Everything else, like workbook pages and such are very helpful to your grade. Attendance is a big part and you can only miss four days

Easy common sense material, you do not need the text, despite what he tells you. 5 worksheets, 4 tests and a written assignment make your grade. Attendance is mandatory and his lecture will make you want to bang your head on the table repeatedly....soooo boring and he repeats everything he says 10 times.. easy class though

Awesome professor. 4 tests, all easy, basic common knowledge-studying will help. Extra credit opportunities. Fun group projects. 5 short, easy, homework assignments. Definitely an easy A as long as you go to class! Highly recommend.

McDonald is hilarious. Class can get boring at times but attending the class is mandatory and will make or break your grade. He really makes Communications interesting, though. If you follow instructions AND pay attention in class/study before tests, you'll get an A.

Class is boring. But you have to go. You earn points every day and they really add up in the end. You don't really NEED the book, but it helps when you're studying - which you should because that makes the tests super easy.

Easy class, but very boring and attendance is part of your grade, so you can't skip. 4 tests, all were easy as long as you study. He puts everything you will need to study online. I wouldn't bother buying the textbook, I made an A with out it. Boring, but if your looking for an easy A, this is the class to take.
Good professor. Material is boring, but he has a good sense of humor which helps. 4 tests, a few very easy homework assignments and a few group projects.

McDonald is hilarious. He is a super cool professor and has been in the business so he knows what he is talking about. No electronics w/o prior permission, and he often goes over the same powerpoint for a class or two in a row, but who cares he is the best take him!! Everything is online and tests are easy. TAKE HIM!!
Prof. McDonald is a great teacher. He mostly lectures but they're very easy to follow. His group activities are interesting and fun. No quizzes. You'll want to get the book. Take him!

Jim is a funny guy, but SOOOO BORING! his lectures are all online and in powerpoints, Attendancd is mandatory or else i wouldnt go to class because of his lectures. 4 test that are really hard, lots of info, HW is rare and easy, 1 group project that counts alot! I would find another professor if I could but would take if I had no other choice.
Follow PowerPoints, take notes. Participate....and you'll be just fine.

I really enjoyed his class! All of the information you need to know for the tests was on his powerpoints, and he does post them online. Homework was simple and to the point. There is a lot of group work/discussion in the class, so if you're stuck in a terrible group it sucks. That's the only downside. There's 1 group project.

Great Teacher! All the Notes he posts online are better (much more clear) than the actual textbook. Make sure you learn the definitions for each chapter (he posts these too) and you will do well on the tests.
He's funny and well rounded as a professor. You may not learn much but you'll be entertained while wasting your money. If you just need a credit take the class and get your A.

I recommend this class! He's really funny, brutally honest, and entertaining. He teaches with PowerPoint, a couple workbook assignments but I never used the actual text. Study guides for every test tell you EXACTLY what you need to know, I got high B's and A's on the 3 tests so far. Group work boosts points for you and keeps things interactive.

This is probabaly one of the easiest classes you can get an A in. He gives points if you show up to class. And for test all you have to do is review his slides. Lots of group projects. Fun teacher and an easy A.

He tried to make this class as entertaining as possible. Overall it wasn't a bad class to take. He's a fun guy and has lots of in class group "projects". He also has a grading system that is not heavily weighted by your tests.
This class was easy however, the midterm and final were difficult.
He's fun!  Take him.  If you aren't a great test taker, he offers other ways to get your points such as worksheets.  You'll also get points for attending class.  You will need the book for studying.

He is a great teacher that truly cares about his students and the class. He can be a bit of a hardass but is really funny and is willing to help you until you understand it. Attendance is mandatory, but you need to go to understand the material. Tests can be difficult, though!

He was great.  Everyone should take this class or anything he teaches.  He cares about his students and tells you how it is real world versus academic. Three hours twice a week in the summer is tough for any class but he made it interesting.  Take him.  He is invested in student success!
A MUST TAKE Professor. He was great and made the subject as enjoyable easy as it can be. No crazy hard assignments. Don't miss out on any course He is teaching!

He takes time to learn everyone's name which is nice and refreshing. He's funny but does ramble a bit. He makes class fun; would totally recommend! Don't miss class or come in late-he deducts points from your FINAL grade.

If you can get into his class TAKE HIM!!!! Awesome instructor.  Everything needed for class is lined up from the beginning which is great if you like to work ahead.  Funny, nice, and always willing to help.

Great professor!!! Group projects weren't your typical dreadful assignments.  He's funny as hell.  He rambles a little but is VERY knowledgable on the subject.  Easy A!!! Would take him again...and again.

Mr. McDonald is really funny and nice.  The beginning of the semester was more bookwork, but towards the end it got to be less book and more writing and group projects.  Glad I got paired up with the folks I did!  (team Illinois!!!) Anyway he is a good man and I respect the hell out of him.  Take him.
Highly recommended!! Everything is outlined in the syllabus all you need to do is attend class  and turn in your assignments.
